   Assessment and Plan
 HEART FAILURE (CHF), SYSTOLIC, ACUTE ON CHRONIC
   Patient is a 32M with idiopathic dilated CM (EF 20%), afib, CVA, SDH,
   and hypothyroidism who is admitted for diuresis and milrinone.
   .
   # PUMP: CHF/Dilated Cardiomyopathy: TTE [**8-3**] showed EF 20%, diagnosed
   after presenting with Class III CHF symptoms in [**9-27**], thought to be
   viral etiology, s/p AICD. His dry weight is 100 kg, currently below dry
   weight at 93kg. Had recent admission at OSH where he presented with LE
   swelling and received IV lasix.  Currently does not appear volume
   overloaded, JVP flat, lungs clear and only trace edema. Plan as
   outlined by Dr. [**First Name (STitle) **]:
   - continue metoprolol 200mg tid to suppress arrythmogenic effects of
   milrinone
   - continue milrinone infusion at .5 mcg/kg/min, can titrate up to
   0.75mcg/kg/min.
   - Start to wean off milrinone late tonight
   - Maintain SBP>80, MAP>40
   - continue digoxin
   - continue lasix gtt, titrate to net negative ~1L daily, inc. to 10
   today
   - continue fluid restriction
   - continue low-dose ACEI
   .
   # RHYTHM: Chronic atrial fibrillation, on Coumadin, diagnosed in the
   setting of hyperthyroidism. Coumadin held [**Date range (1) 2788**] s/p SDH.
   Initially held this hospitalization for INR 3.5.  INR today 2.9
   - restart lower dose coumadin
   - uptitrate metoprolol as above
   .
   # h/o Ventricular Tachycardia: first noted in [**9-27**], had non sustained
   30 second run seen on Holter [**8-29**], s/p syncope from VT in [**9-1**].
   - monitor on telemetry
   - ICD in place
   - maintain K >4, Mg >2
   .
   # NEURO: s/p CVA as well as SDH. On Keppra for sz prophylaxis.
   Admitted to OSH in [**9-2**] after seizure at home and he was started on
   Keppra. Has been seizure free.
   - Cont Keppra 250mg [**Hospital1 **]
   .
   # Thyroid dysfunction: Originally had hyperthyroidism, secondary to
   Amiodarone (d/ced [**3-1**]), s/p prednisone and methimazole-->
   hypothyroidism
   -continue synthroid
   .
   # CRI: Baseline Cr 1.7-1.8.  Likely related to poor forward flow. Cr
   down to below baseline today at 1.5 with diuresis.
   - Cont to follow with diuresis
   - renally dose meds
   .
   # Anemia: Baseline Hct in low 30s.  Iron studies c/w chronic disease.
   Currently at baseline, no signs of bleeding
   -Cont. to follow
   -GAS
   .
   # Osteoporosis: continue Ca, Vitamin D
   .
   # FEN: low Na diet, follow and replete lytes, fluid restrict 1.5L
   .
   # Access: PIV x2, ? PICC for home milrinone
   .
   # PPx: therapeutic on coumadin
   .
   # Code: FULL
   ICU Care

Summary:
Based on the provided progress note, the patient is a 32-year-old male with a history of idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy (EF 20%), atrial fibrillation, cerebrovascular accident (CVA), subdural hematoma (SDH), and hypothyroidism. He was admitted for diuresis and milrinone infusion.

The patient has been diagnosed with heart failure (CHF) due to his dilated cardiomyopathy. He presented with Class III CHF symptoms and was found to have an ejection fraction (EF) of 20%. The patient also has chronic atrial fibrillation, which was initially diagnosed during an episode of hyperthyroidism. His International Normalized Ratio (INR) is currently at 2.9, and he will be restarted on a lower dose of Coumadin.

The patient has a history of ventricular tachycardia, for which an implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) has been placed. He is currently on metoprolol to suppress arrhythmogenic effects of milrinone and will continue to be monitored on telemetry.

The patient also has a history of CVA and SDH. He was admitted to the hospital after experiencing a seizure at home and started on Keppra for seizure prophylaxis. He has been seizure-free since then.

The patient's thyroid function was originally hyperthyroidism secondary to Amiodarone, and he was treated with pred

Summary:
Based on the provided progress note, the patient is a 32-year-old male with a history of idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy (EF 20%), atrial fibrillation, cerebrovascular accident (CVA), subdural hematoma (SDH), and hypothyroidism. He was admitted for diuresis and milrinone.

The patient's current condition includes:
- Heart failure (systolic), acute on chronic: The patient has a significantly reduced ejection fraction (EF) of 20% due to dilated cardiomyopathy. He presented with Class III heart failure symptoms and was diagnosed after presenting with chest pain. The patient also has a history of ventricular tachycardia.
- Chronic atrial fibrillation: The patient has chronic atrial fibrillation, which was initially diagnosed in the setting of hyperthyroidism. His Coumadin was held due to a subdural hematoma and initially held this hospitalization for an INR of 3.5. Currently, his INR is 2.9.
- History of seizure: The patient had a seizure and was started on Keppra during his previous admission to OSH.
- Thyroid dysfunction: The patient initially had hyperthyroidism secondary to amiodarone use, but has since developed hypothyroidism after treatment with prednisone and methimazole.
- Chronic renal insufficiency: The patient has a baseline creatinine level of 1
